snippet: In a country that seems be growing more insular in some ways, an exhibit at Israel’s national museum tries to convey a more universal message: the story of civilization’s origins and development.
abstract: Israel Museum in Jerusalem celebrates 50th anniversary with exhibit A Brief History of Humankind, inspired by Israeli historian Yuval Noah Harari's bestselling book Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind; display consists of primitive artifacts and depictions of modern day life, in effort to prompt visitors to make a connection between ancient and contemporary life.
lead_paragraph: In a country that seems be growing more insular in some ways, an exhibit at Israel’s national museum tries to convey a more universal message: the story of civilization’s origins and development.

headline.main: To Celebrate 50 Years, the Israel Museum Looks Back Much Further
headline.print_headline: Celebrating 50 Years With an Even Longer Look Back
